title: Man Utd legend Paul Ince hits out at David de Gea over post-match interview

Paul Ince has slammed 'clueless' David de Gea for this post-match interview after Manchester United's defeat to Newcastle .

The Red Devils suffered a 1-0 defeat to the Magpies on Sunday to extend their worst start to a season for 30 years, as they slumped to 12th in the Premier League.

Immediately after the game, Spanish keeper de Gea was put up by the club to speak to Sky Sports.

"It is not acceptable, not just this game but the whole season," De Gea said.

"It is the most difficult time since I have been here. I don't know what is happening. We cannot even score one goal in two games."

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

The interview seemed to be an emotional one for de Gea, who has been at Old Trafford since 2011, who struggled to find the right words.

But United legend Ince was not impressed with his words and branded him clueless and not befitting of a leader.

“I watched David De Gea’s post-match interview and I was at a loss," Ince told Paddy Power.

“He’s meant to be one of the leaders, if that was Peter Schmeichel standing there, there’s no chance you’d have seen that interview.

(Image: Getty Images)

“Rather than him addressing and recognising where the team were going wrong, it just felt like ‘I don’t know, I don’t know, I don’t know.’

“This is one of the top players, the leaders at Manchester United , who has just signed a five-year contract!

“And he looks like he doesn’t have a clue what’s going on. If you’re a United fan listening to your goalkeeper, one of the main leaders in the team, and that’s the interview you here you’d be right to be disgraced.

“I’d be looking thinking, Jesus, he doesn’t have a clue what’s going on – I bet he’s regretting signing that contract.”

Paul Ince was speaking exclusively to Paddy Power News. To read more, visit news.paddypower.com
description: David de Gea said Man Utd's defeat to Newcastle on Sunday added to the "most difficult time" since he joined the Red Devils
